A: Jesus' Teaching on How to pray
1. Jesus taught us some ways to _ (a) Pray (b) Sing (c) Dance
2. According to Jesus, we should pray without _ (a) Eating (b) Ceasing (c) Sleeping
3. Praying without ceasing means we pray to God _ (a) Sometimes (b) Never (c) Always
4. We should pray to God in _ (a) Public (b) Secret (c) Groups
5. We should not pray because we want people to _ what we are praying about (a) See (b) Hear (c) Judge
6. If the answer to our prayer has not come, we should keep _ (a) Waiting (b) Praying (c) Complaining
7. We should pray without getting _ (a) Tired (b) Discouraged (c) Hungry
8. We should pray in faith without _ (a) Doubt (b) Fear (c) Hesitation
9. We should have _ that God will hear us whenever we pray (a) Hope (b) Belief (c) Wish
10. We should pray for something _ (a) General (b) Specific (c) Vague
11. Pray for what you want God to do for you is an example of praying for something _ (a) Specific (b) Broad (c) Unclear
Jesus' power over Natural forces
12. Jesus is the _ of God (a) Servant (b) Son (c) Prophet
13. Jesus has power over all things on _ (a) Heaven (b) Earth (c) Sea
14. Jesus has power over natural _ (a) Animals (b) Forces (c) People
15. Jesus demonstrated his power by calming the _ (a) River (b) Lake (c) Sea
16. There was a great _ which almost sank the ship (a) Rain (b) Storm (c) Earthquake
17. Jesus spoke to the wind and said '_ be still' (a) Stop (b) Peace (c) Quiet
18. When Jesus spoke, the wind stopped _ (a) Slowly (b) Immediately (c) Later
19. Jesus also demonstrated his power by walking on the _ (a) Land (b) Water (c) Sea
Feeding of the five Thousand people
20. Jesus went to the _ with his disciples (a) City (b) Mountain (c) Village
21. About _ thousand people followed Jesus and his disciples (a) Two (b) Three (c) Five
22. Jesus called one of his _ to ask about getting bread (a) Friends (b) Disciples (c) Family
23. A boy had _ loaves of bread and two small fishes (a) Three (b) Five (c) Seven
24. The boy also had two small _ (a) Birds (b) Fishes (c) Loaves
25. After everyone ate, they had _ full baskets of leftovers (a) Ten (b) Twelve (c) Fifteen
26. The people who ate were _ (a) Hungry (b) Satisfied (c) Thirsty
People whom Jesus healed and raised from the dead
27. Peter's Mother-in-law was among the people Jesus _ (a) Taught (b) Healed (c) Met
28. The _ man was healed by Jesus (a) Blind (b) Deaf (c) Paralysed
29. Jesus raised Jairus's _ from the dead (a) Son (b) Daughter (c) Wife
30. The _ son was also raised from the dead by Jesus (a) Rich (b) Widow's (c) Priest's
B: 1. What does it mean to pray without ceasing_________
2. Where should we pray to God according to Jesus' teaching_________
3. What did Jesus say to the wind to calm the sea_________
4. How many loaves of bread and fishes did the boy have when Jesus fed the five thousand_________
5. Name two people whom Jesus raised from the dead_________
answers_B: It means to pray to God always.
Five loaves of bread and two small fishes.
Jairus's Daughter and The widow's son.
answers_C: Jesus performed many miracles, healing the sick and raising the dead, demonstrating his power over diseases and death.

Praying in faith without doubt means having a strong belief that God will hear and respond to our prayers. It emphasizes trust in God's power and willingness to act, which is crucial for effective prayer.

Jesus demonstrated his power over natural forces by calming a violent storm on the sea, telling the wind "Peace be still," and by walking on the surface of the sea. These acts show his authority over creation.

Jesus fed five thousand people with only five loaves of bread and two small fishes. He prayed over the food, and it multiplied, satisfying everyone with 12 baskets of leftovers. This miracle demonstrates his divine power and compassion.

From Jesus' teachings, we learn to pray consistently ("without ceasing"), humbly and privately ("in secret"), persistently ("without getting discouraged"), with unwavering belief ("in faith without doubt"), and with clear intentions ("for something specific").

The miracles of healing the sick (like Peter's mother-in-law and the paralysed man) and raising the dead (like Jairus's daughter, the widow's son, and Lazarus) unequivocally show Jesus' divine power over life and death, proving his authority as the Son of God.
